text: George Wellington "Cap" Streeter (1837 - January 22, 1921) was an American businessman and criminal. He was born near the town of Flint, Michigan. From 1886 to 1921, Streeter was in many scandals such as, forged legal documents and used violence to wrest of Lake Michigan shoreline away from its rightful owners. He then turned to conning the poor by selling them land that he did not own.Salzmann, Joshua,Journal of Illinois History, Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, Autumn 2006, pg.201 Vol. 9 Number 3 He was convicted of manslaughter in 1902 and was sent to prison. He died of pneumonia. A Chicago neighborhood, Streeterville is named after him. ==References== Category:1837 births Category:1921 deaths Category:American fraudsters Category:American people convicted of manslaughter Category:Businesspeople from Michigan Category:Businesspeople from Chicago Category:Criminals from Michigan Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Chicago Category:People from Flint, Michigan
title: George Streeter
